I do think Enrique Iglesias is underrated, at least in the English market. He has only two #1 on Billboard Hot 100 compared to 26 on Hot Latin Songs. He had a quite disappointing career beginning from low sales of his album 7. The same trend was seen in Insomniac, though it was quite a major hit in Europe. Songs rarely touched the Hot 100, though he got lots of no 1s in France, Russia etc. Even now, be I believe the following is the reason:- 1. Enrique Iglesias' music is too generic. Definitely. Listen to I Like It, and then I'm A Freak. "Freak" sounded a half hearted attempt to make a party song. And the trashy verse from Pitbull. It was preceded by flops like Turn The Night Up, Heart Attac, a minor hit Finally Found You. 2. Small English Fan Base. Yeah, its true. If it were large, he would have success on average tracks too. Instead, they disappeared without much sign on Billboards. His songs must be very, very good to chart. Don't get me wrong. His Spanish songs can be more successful than English songs of most other artists. Bailando became 10th best selling song of 2014, which is a big achievement considering the fact that most people who have bought it did not understand it. Moreover his songs sell very well in Latin America. Sex and Love got 9 Platinums in this region, but fared poorly outside. So ultimately its the question of which market you are talking about. He should concentrate more on Spanish, or so it seems for now. BTW I'm a die hard EI fan, but this is the truth.
